p: As shown in Table 1, 21 chemical compositions were distinguished in the fresh and dried samples of S. lavandulifolia. The results showed that the major constituents in the fresh samples were spathulenol (21%), myrcene (13.5%), β‐pinene (9.8%), δ‐cadinene (9.8%), and α‐muurolol (9%). The results also clarified that regardless of drying methods, the main compositions remained spathulenol (0.6%–22.6%), cyrene (0.3%–17.5%), δ‐cadinene (0.1%–18.7%), p‐cymene (t–27.5%), decane (t–24.1%), α‐terpinene (t–18.4%), β‐pinene (0.3%–17.5%) and intermedeol (0.1%–12.5%).
